pros: People Friendly environment Great team Benefits
cons: There are no cons I can think of

review_title: Supportive Workplace with Amazing Benefits and Many Advancement Opportunities
job_title: Library Reference Assistant in Allentown, PA
pros: What makes Cedar Crest College a wonderful place to work is its faculty and staff - the people I worked with are still friends and supporters today. The benefits and vacation/holiday package are very generous. Many opportunities for advancement as well as education opportunities for both the employees and their family. A fun place to work with a successful and ambitious student body. Lots of employee recognition and feedback on performance. I received much career advice and guidance from my supportive supervisors. College leadership has its priorities and heart in the right place.
cons: Low salary. Long hours. Limited graduate opportunities and no funding for employee graduate school goals.

pros: Professors are friendly, labs are typically very simple and easy to get through

review_title: Great Students but Very Low Pay
pros: Great, engaging students who are engaged.  Colleagues are deeply committed to their education both in and out of the classroom.  Great place for young women who want a serious education and who may not be a good fit at a large campus.
cons: Very low pay for the amount of work you -- committee work, research, and teaching a 4/4 load.  Basically, you work like a community college professor -- a lot of teaching -- and yet are expected to do the research required to be published.

pros: The faculty and staff are wonderful and the students are great!
cons: The pay is terrible Other colleges pay $76,000 to $80,000 for a 9 or 10 month contract--NOT 12
